annotations.description: We saw a few chances and nice plays, but the overall impression of the game is uninspiring and not hugely entertaining. There wasn't any significant dominance by either side in this game. The home team tried to find the weakness in the opposition's defence mostly using rapid counter attacks. On the other hand, long balls and crosses were the main weapons of the away team.

annotations.label: soccer-ball
annotations.description: It's in the back of the net! Superb finishing from Bafetimbi Gomis (Swansea). Andre Ayew plays a fantastic through ball and finds Bafetimbi Gomis (Swansea), who reacts quickly to get in front of the goalkeeper and fire a close range shot into the bottom right corner. 2:1.
The linesman signals that Gylfi Sigurdsson (Swansea) is offside and the referee confirms the decision.
It's a weak and poor shot by Jonjo Shelvey (Swansea) as he flashes a first time shot from the edge of the box. The ball flies well wide of the right post.
Gylfi Sigurdsson (Swansea) wastes a good opportunity as his pass into the box is blocked by the defence.

annotations.label: soccer-ball
annotations.description: A perfect lofted pass from Gylfi Sigurdsson finds Andre Ayew (Swansea), who jumps highest and steers a close range header into the left side of the goal. His effort was both strong and precise, and Sergio Romero had no chance of stopping that. 0:0.

Juan Manuel Mata (Manchester United) receives a pass inside the box, controls the ball and drills it towards the left post. Unfortunately for him, Lukasz Fabianski makes a great save to stop his effort.

annotations.label: soccer-ball
annotations.description: It's in the back of the net! Luke Shaw plays it into the box, and Mata (Manchester United) gets on the end of the cross to put it into the roof of the net. 0:1.
Sergio Romero reacts well to deny a long range free kick from Jonjo Shelvey (Swansea) towards the left side of the goal.
Martin Atkinson couldn't ignore the rough tackle by Matteo Darmian (Manchester United) and blew his whistle. Swansea are awarded a free kick. Let's see what they create from this.

annotations.label: whistle
annotations.description: The players are back out on the pitch following the half time break and the second half is about to start.

We are seeing rather average performance so far. The fans would surely appreciate more interesting moments. No side has really dominated in this first half. The home team tries to find the weakness in the opposition's defence, especially with rapid counter attacks, while the away team play possession football.

annotations.label: y-card
annotations.description: Wayne Routledge (Swansea) can't expect anything else than a yellow card for his hard tackle. And a yellow it is. Martin Atkinson didn't think twice about pulling it out of his pocket.

annotations.label: y-card

Bafetimbi Gomis (Swansea) is offside and the linesman raises his flag.

Juan Manuel Mata (Manchester United) carelessly slides into the feet of his opponent and he'll be lucky to avoid punishment. Martin Atkinson blows for the foul but keeps his cards in his pocket on this occasion.
Wayne Rooney (Manchester United) darts into the penalty area to latch on to a pass, and he unleashes a shot towards the middle of the net, but Lukasz Fabianski is alert and denies him.
Andre Ayew (Swansea) was all set to receive a beautiful pass into a promising position. However, one of the defenders makes a timely clearance.
Matteo Darmian (Manchester United) produces a quality cross into the box, but the opposition's defence intercepts the ball and spanks it away.
Off the post! Bafetimbi Gomis (Swansea) amazingly found his way through the defence, but lacked a precise finish as his effort from close range bounced off the left post.
Sergio Romero had to pull off an exquisite save to thwart a knuckleball from Jonjo Shelvey (Swansea), even though it only went towards the middle of the target.
Gylfi Sigurdsson (Swansea) makes space inside the box for a shot, but his effort goes just wide of the left post.
Jonjo Shelvey (Swansea) decides to speed play up by quickly sending the free kick into the box.

Bafetimbi Gomis (Swansea) shoots after receiving a good pass. His effort from the edge of the box goes just wide of the right post.

Kyle Naughton (Swansea) is obviously not following the Golden Rule: „Treat others as you want to be treated.“ He makes a bad challenge and leaves Martin Atkinson with no other option than to blow for a foul. Manchester United have a free kick from a promising distance.
